title: Instagram Offers to Cover Celebrity Video Costs...But There's a Catch
text: Instagram is willing to pick up the tab for some celebrities’ video production costs. As long as they don’t film anything about politics or elections. Bloomberg's Sarah Frier reports on "Bloomberg Technology."

title: Facebook entering the fintech space with a new payment service
text: Kate Rooney reports that Facebook is creating a new payments service. With CNBC's Melissa Lee and the Fast Money traders, Dan Nathan, Lori Calvasina, Karen Finerman and Guy Adami.

title: Facebook confirms bug grants access to iPhone users' cameras
text: A ‘worrying’ system bug has been allowing app to access cameras as users scroll through their feed

title: Stocks Rise Modestly, Crispr Breaks Out, Facebook Nears Buy Point
text: Stocks rise modestly: Crispr breaks out, Facebook nears buy point, D.R. Horton wild.

title: Staffers blast Facebook’s ‘black people problem’ in open letter
text: Facebook is still inhospitable to its minority employees — despite its efforts to confront racism within its ranks, several of the company’s staffers say.

title: Facebook Pay will let you send payments on Messenger, WhatsApp and Instagram
text: Payments on Facebook, Messenger, WhatsApp and Instagram will fall under Facebook Pay.

title: Facebook is launching a pay system across Facebook, Messenger, Instagram, WhatsApp
text: Facebook Inc. just dove into payment systems with a service across Facebook, Messenger, Instagram, and WhatsApp.

title: Breakup Talk Will Have Little Impact on Facebook Stock
text: Talk of breaking up Facebook may lead to buying opportunities in FB stock, but with the DOJ's weak case, Facebook is FB's biggest threat.

title: Facebook wants you to pay people on Messenger, Instagram, and WhatsApp with Facebook Pay
Facebook to consolidate payments tools across apps with Facebook Pay
text: Facebook Inc  said on Tuesday it was launching Facebook Pay, a service that will help consolidate payments tools across its social media platforms including Whatsapp and Instagram.

title: Facebook takes on Venmo with new payments tool that can be used across its family of apps
text: Facebook Pay is a major step towards Facebook's goal of linking Instagram, Messenger and WhatsApp together.

title: Facebook's latest step to tie its apps together: Facebook Pay
text: Facebook is taking another step to tie its massive social media applications more closely together at a time when there are mounting calls for the company to be broken up.

title: 3 Reasons Facebook's VR Bet Hasn't Paid Off...Yet
text: The VR industry hasn't lived up to expectations.

title: 7 Tech Stocks to Buy for the Rest of 2019
text: Historically, the end of the year is the most profitable time for stocks. With that in the mind, here are seven tech names to pick up during holiday shopping.

title: Facebook Users Give the Platform a Vote of Confidence in Q3 2019
text: The data privacy debate has given way to a more politically charged one, but Facebook’s growth is alive and well.

title: 3 Companies You Don't Realize You Lean On Every Day
text: A next-gen ad agency, a social networking giant, and an in-app communications leader are companies you can't seem to avoid these days.

title: 3 Reasons Why Facebook Can Maintain Its Stunning Growth Rates
text: The social media giant reported strong revenue and profit growth numbers during the last quarter. Here are three reasons why those rates are sustainable.

title: Dutch court orders Facebook to ban celebrity crypto scam ads after another lawsuit
text: A Dutch court has ruled that Facebook can be required to use filter technologies to identify and pre-emptively take down fake ads linked to crypto currency scams that carry the image of a media personality, John de Mol. The Dutch celerity filed a lawsuit against Facebook in April over the misappropriation of his likeness to […]
